definition: the young of an animal or a family of young, the young (as of a bird or insect) hatched or cared for at one time
examples: a hen with her brood of chicks

definition: a group having a common nature or origin
examples: the entire brood of chronicle plays
takes their brood to church every Sunday

definition: kept for breeding (see breed entry 1 sense 3)
to produce by or as if by incubation : hatch
to think anxiously or gloomily about : ponder
examples: I used to brood these things on my walk

definition: to sit quietly and thoughtfully : meditate

examples: the old fort brooding above the valley

definition: to dwell gloomily on a subject
to be in a state of depression
